p: The extracts of the C. zedoaria rhizome have been reported to inhibit carrageenan-induced pro-inflammatory responses and suppress the acute inflammatory response induced by tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate (TPA) in rat and mouse ears [ 43, 44]. Furthermore, the isolated compound germacrone from the methanol extract of C. xanthorrhiza rhizome demonstrated the inhibition of paw edema [ 52], whereas the non-phenolic diarylheptanoids displayed the significant inhibition of carrageenan-induced hind paw edema in rats [ 54, 55].
